trends: There has been one other sighting in Orleans
There were no other sightings in Orleans on or around October 10th 2009
divs: Sighting Detailsi watched a light come closer to where i was parked at boat meadow at eastham from 7pm to 8pm.i missed the sunset by a few minutes.i stayed in my truck and watched the sky as it was a grand array of colors.as dusk approached and the sky became darker i watched this yellowish light move side to side up and down and not appear to get any closer.meanwhile there was only two other cars there.one of the cars a young lady was phographing the sunset,with a camera mounted on a tripod,in front of me.i got out of my truck and as the light i had seen was alot closer now.i got a little scarred,i relized it was a ufo,as i have seen one up close when i was younger.i asked the younglady what did she think we were watching?she said,"a ufo"."i said your right",aren"t you scarred?she said nothing,i said i was.now i could make out the outline and shape of this craft.i saw two lights one yellowish and the other white on each side.it was shaped like a large triangle and emitted no noise.a tow truck driver showed up with a flatbed.one of the cars would not start.i asked the tow truck driver what he thought we were watching?he agreed it was a ufo".i decided to get a friend of mine and share this sighting.he lived 5to7 minutes away and was staying in his fishing shack.when we got back i asked the girl with the camera if she got a picture of the craft?she showed me and i saw the lights and shape.but not as clear as i had seen with my eyes.i asked her her name.she told me it was amber,and i told her to contact mufon and to send me a photo to my email.i have been waiting.meanwhile my friend saw the lights as they went back over the bay.an interesting and a bit scarry experience.sincerely,amn
Summary: After watching sunset, I saw a yellowish non blinking light cresting the water and the horizen.
